wines.description: A Virginia Cabernet Franc from Zephaniah Farm Vineyard's estate in Loudoun County. The 2016 vintage blends Cabernet Franc with a small amount of Petit Manseng for added aromatics. The 2013 vintage won silver medals at the Virginia Governor's Cup and Loudoun County Wine Awards.

tastingNotes.aroma: Aromatic and fruity nose with the Petit Manseng addition creating enhanced floral character. Classic Cabernet Franc red fruit aromatics of raspberry and red cherry emerge alongside subtle herbal notes of fresh-cut grass and green bell pepper. Violet and rose petal notes add elegance to the bouquet.
tastingNotes.palate: The flavor profile is fruity with strong Cabernet Franc character showing red and dark fruits, particularly cherry and cassis. The wine displays complexity and depth with well-integrated tannins from the Virginia terroir. Medium to full body with balanced acidity keeping the fruit fresh and vibrant. The Petit Manseng adds a subtle exotic fruit character that complements the Cab Franc structure.
tastingNotes.finish: Medium to long finish with persistent fruit and subtle herbal notes. Well-developed tannins provide structure without being aggressive, making this wine ready to drink now while having aging potential.

foodPairings: Grilled lamb chops with herbs de Provence
Roasted duck breast with cherry reduction

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 30 minutes to allow aromatics to develop
servingInfo.glassware: Bordeaux glass or large red wine glass

wineDetails.grapeVariety: Primarily Cabernet Franc with a dash of Petit Manseng
wineDetails.ageability: Drinking well now through 2026. The wine is well-developed and perfect for current consumption

wines.description: A powerful Australian Shiraz from the Limestone Coast region, crafted specifically to pair with grilled meats and barbecue. This wine is part of the Beefsteak Club line designed for food-friendly, bold red wines with character.

tastingNotes.aroma: Dark purple color introduces expressive aromas of ripe plums and juicy black currants. Blackberry and fragrant white pepper add complexity alongside subtle earthy notes typical of the Limestone Coast terroir. The oak aging contributes hints of vanilla and spice.
tastingNotes.palate: Fresh, complex, elegant and juicy personality on the palate with spicy, warm notes from oak aging perfectly integrated into the powerful body. Full and juicy with notes of blackcurrant and plum that create a rich mid-palate. The wine balances power with elegance, showing both fruit concentration and structural finesse.
tastingNotes.finish: Smooth finish with soft, long-lasting tannins. The tannin framework is wonderfully fine and accompanies into a long, intense finish with lingering blackcurrant and plum flavors.

foodPairings: Lamb shanks braised in red wine

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 30-45 minutes to soften tannins and integrate oak
servingInfo.glassware: Large Shiraz or Syrah glass to capture the bold aromatics

wineDetails.style: Bold, full-bodied Australian Shiraz with oak aging
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2027. The wine shows good structure for medium-term aging

wines.description: A bright, crunchy Grenache from 100+ year-old vines at Schlieb's Garden vineyard in Vine Vale, Barossa Valley. Winemaker Sierra Reed crafts this wine in a Beaujolais style - vibrant and effortless to drink, showcasing the purity of old vine Barossa Grenache.

tastingNotes.aroma: Aromas of rose petal, riberry, and pomegranate lead the bouquet. Sweet spice and pink pepper add complexity alongside strawberry gum notes. Old terracotta and earth provide a grounding element, while the wine maintains bright and juicy characteristics throughout.
tastingNotes.palate: Fine tannins and an hourglass shape define the wine's elegant mouthfeel. Crushed dried flowers and ripe red fruits dominate the palate with medium body and intense Barossa flavor. The wine is bright, crunchy, and effortless to drink, showing the purity and energy of old vine fruit without excessive extraction.
tastingNotes.finish: The finish showcases the wine's finesse with lingering red fruit and floral notes. Integrated tannins provide structure without weight, making this truly exceptional Grenache highly drinkable.

foodPairings: Grilled lamb with herbs and pomegranate

servingInfo.decanting: Brief 15-20 minute decant or none needed
servingInfo.glassware: Burgundy glass or universal wine glass

wineDetails.region: Vine Vale, Barossa Valley, South Australia
wineDetails.grapeVariety: 100% Grenache from 100+ year-old vines at Schlieb's Garden
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2026. Best enjoyed for its vibrant, youthful character

wines.description: One of Languedoc-Roussillon's finest biodynamic reds from the Cru La Livinière appellation. This 80% Syrah, 20% Grenache blend earned 94 points from Jeb Dunnuck and 93 points from James Suckling. The 79-acre estate has been certified biodynamic by Demeter since 2008.

tastingNotes.aroma: The aromatic bouquet features Provençal herbs - thyme, rosemary, and lavender - alongside menthol notes creating a garrigue character. Juicy black cherries and melted chocolate provide richness. Blackcurrant, licorice, pepper, and cold meats add savory complexity to this multi-layered nose.
tastingNotes.palate: Sautéed black cherries and blackcurrant dominate the palate with notes of licorice and black pepper. The 80% Syrah provides structure and spice while the 20% Grenache adds roundness and red fruit. Eight days of fermentation in concrete and wood followed by 12 months in French oak and 6 months in concrete egg creates excellent integration and complexity.
tastingNotes.finish: Long, persistent finish with lingering dark fruit, spice, and herbal notes. The biodynamic farming shines through in the wine's purity and energy, while the oak aging provides polish without dominating the fruit.

foodPairings: Braised lamb shanks with herbs de Provence
Aged Comté or hard mountain cheeses

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 1 hour to fully express the complex aromatics

wineDetails.region: Cru La Livinière, Minervois, Languedoc-Roussillon, France
wineDetails.grapeVariety: 80% Syrah, 20% Grenache from clay-limestone and clay-sandstone soils
wineDetails.style: Biodynamic Cru red, 12 months oak + 6 months concrete egg aging
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2032. Excellent structure for mid to long-term aging

wines.description: A Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon from Chile's Calyptra estate. This wine represents extended aging and careful selection, following traditional Gran Reserva protocols for premium Chilean Cabernet with excellent structure and complexity.

tastingNotes.aroma: Intense aromas of ripe blackcurrant and black cherry with notes of cedar, tobacco, and dark chocolate from oak aging. Hints of eucalyptus and mint typical of premium Chilean Cabernet add complexity. Subtle leather and cigar box notes emerge from the Gran Reserva aging.
tastingNotes.palate: Full-bodied with concentrated dark fruit flavors of blackberry, cassis, and plum. The Gran Reserva aging creates excellent integration of oak with flavors of vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice. Firm but refined tannins provide structure while the vibrant acidity keeps the palate fresh despite the wine's richness.
tastingNotes.finish: Long, elegant finish with persistent dark fruit and oak-derived spice. The tannins are well-integrated providing structure for aging. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee linger alongside the fruit concentration.

foodPairings: Roasted leg of lamb with rosemary

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 1-2 hours to soften tannins and develop complexity
servingInfo.glassware: Large Bordeaux or Cabernet Sauvignon glass

wineDetails.style: Gran Reserva with extended oak aging
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2034. Excellent aging potential for Chilean Cabernet

wines.description: A classic brut Champagne from Maison Bauget-Jouette in Épernay. This non-vintage cuvée showcases the house style of freshness, elegance, and remarkable persistence. The wine displays wonderful presence and fine-grained texture with crisp, bright apple intensity.

tastingNotes.aroma: Fresh and light nose of apples, pear, and peaches with distinctive white flowers. Apple flesh, hazelnut, and fresh almond create complexity. Aromas of grapefruit, white cherry, and pastry crust add depth to the elegant bouquet.
tastingNotes.palate: Intricate layers of plums, white flowers, and pink Lady apples underpinned by notes of toasted hazelnut. Flavors of citrus, apple, and nectarine create a fruit-forward palate. Round in the mouth with fine and creamy bubbles supported by a fresh and elegant structure. Wonderful presence on the palate with vinosity and fine-grained texture.
tastingNotes.finish: Wonderfully long and fresh finish with remarkable persistence. Crisp aftertaste with lingering apple and citrus notes. The fine bubbles continue through the finish creating an elegant, refreshing conclusion.

foodPairings: Soft-ripened cheeses like Brie or Camembert

servingInfo.decanting: No decanting needed; serve directly from ice bucket

wineDetails.grapeVariety: Traditional Champagne blend (typically Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier)
wineDetails.style: Brut Champagne with fine, creamy bubbles and fresh character
wineDetails.ageability: Drink within 2-3 years of purchase for optimal freshness

wines.description: A classic Stellenbosch Merlot from vineyards high on the steep shale slopes of Remhoogte's estate. The southerly-facing slope provides the ideal aspect for Merlot in the region. This wine earned 4.5 Stars from Platter's and 94 Points in Wine Mag's Top 10 Prescient Merlot Report.

tastingNotes.aroma: Juicy aromas of blackberry and integrated oak create an inviting bouquet. Red cherry and dark plum notes add complexity alongside subtle savory elements. Hints of chocolate, spice, and herbs from the Stellenbosch terroir round out the aromatic profile.
tastingNotes.palate: Classic in style showing juicy dark fruit with excellent concentration. Flavors of cherry and chocolate are accented by subtle savory notes and a hint of spice. Broad chalky tannins provide structure while fresh acidity brings balance and vibrancy. The wine shows both power and elegance typical of premium Stellenbosch Merlot.
tastingNotes.finish: Lengthy finish with excellent balance and persistence. The broad chalky tannins carry through providing structure, while the fresh acidity ensures a clean, vibrant conclusion with lingering dark fruit and subtle oak.

foodPairings: Grilled lamb chops or rack of lamb
South African bobotie or spiced meat dishes

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 30-45 minutes to integrate oak and soften tannins
servingInfo.glassware: Bordeaux or large red wine glass

wineDetails.style: Premium Stellenbosch Merlot with oak aging
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2030. Excellent structure for medium-term aging

wines.description: A Catalan rosé from the Costa del Maresme DO, a coastal wine region northeast of Barcelona. This Mediterranean rosé showcases the fresh, fruit-forward character of Spanish coastal winemaking with excellent acidity from sea breezes.

tastingNotes.aroma: Fresh red berry aromatics of strawberry, raspberry, and wild strawberries dominate. Delicate floral notes of rose petals and white flowers add elegance. Subtle citrus and Mediterranean herbs provide complexity with a hint of saline minerality from the coastal influence.
tastingNotes.palate: Light to medium-bodied with vibrant acidity and crisp, refreshing fruit. Red berry flavors of strawberry and cranberry are balanced by citrus notes and subtle minerality. The coastal influence provides a fresh, sea-breeze character that keeps the palate lively and food-friendly.
tastingNotes.finish: Clean, refreshing finish with lingering berry fruit and bright acidity. The mineral character carries through providing a satisfying, thirst-quenching conclusion perfect for Mediterranean cuisine.

servingInfo.glassware: White wine glass or rosé tulip glass

wineDetails.region: DO Costa del Maresme, Catalonia, Spain
wineDetails.grapeVariety: Likely Garnacha and/or local Catalan varietals
wineDetails.ageability: Drink within 1-2 years for optimal freshness

wines.description: A single-vineyard Pinot Noir from the acclaimed Dutton-Campbell Vineyard in Green Valley of Russian River Valley. Wonderment Wines specializes in handcrafted, small-production Pinot Noirs from premier Sonoma sites. The 2016 vintage earned 94 points from James Suckling.

tastingNotes.aroma: Classic Russian River Pinot Noir aromatics of red cherry, cranberry, and strawberry with elegant floral notes. Subtle earth, forest floor, and mushroom add complexity. Delicate spice notes from French oak integration enhance without dominating the pure fruit expression.
tastingNotes.palate: Silky texture with bright red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate. Medium body with excellent balance between fruit concentration and vibrant acidity. The Green Valley site provides cool-climate elegance with fine-grained tannins and remarkable precision. Subtle oak spice and earth notes add depth to the refined fruit profile.
tastingNotes.finish: Long, elegant finish with persistent red fruit and subtle earthiness. The silky tannins provide structure without weight, showcasing the finesse of this premier vineyard site.

foodPairings: Roasted duck breast with cherry sauce
Mushroom risotto or wild mushroom tart

servingInfo.decanting: Decant for 20-30 minutes to open up the aromatics

wineDetails.region: Green Valley of Russian River Valley, Sonoma County, California
wineDetails.ageability: Drink now through 2027. Showing tertiary complexity with good structure

wines.description: A large-format sparkling rosé in keg format designed for high-volume service. This wine is crafted for restaurant and bar service, providing fresh, consistent sparkling rosé on tap with the convenience of keg delivery.

tastingNotes.aroma: Fresh red berry aromatics of strawberry and raspberry with floral notes. Clean, bright fruit-forward style designed for approachability and consistency. Subtle citrus and light yeast notes add complexity.
tastingNotes.palate: Light to medium-bodied with lively bubbles and refreshing acidity. Red berry flavors dominate with strawberry, cherry, and cranberry notes. The palate is crisp and food-friendly with balanced fruit sweetness and acidity. The keg format ensures consistent carbonation and freshness.
tastingNotes.finish: Clean, refreshing finish with bright acidity and lingering berry fruit. The bubbles persist through the finish creating a lively, festive character perfect for by-the-glass service.

servingInfo.glassware: White wine glass or sparkling wine flute

wineDetails.style: Sparkling rosé in 20-liter keg format for tap service
wineDetails.ageability: Serve fresh; keg wine designed for immediate consumption

metadata.researchMethod: WebSearch with professional wine publications and winery sources
